org.ow2.chameleon.core.activators

Class DirectoryMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.chameleon.core.activators.DirectoryMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator, org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTrackerCustomizer<Deployer,Deployer>, Watcher

    public class DirectoryMonitor
extends Object
implements org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator, Watcher, org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTrackerCustomizer<Deployer,Deployer>
    Monitors a directory. It tracks all deployer services exposed in the framework and delegate the file events to the adequate deployer.
    Version:
    $Id: 1.0.4 $Id
    Author:
    The OW2 Chameleon Team

      • acquireWriteLockIfNotHeld

        public boolean acquireWriteLockIfNotHeld()
        Acquires the write lock only and only if the write lock is not already held by the current thread.
        Returns:
        true if the lock was acquired within the method, false otherwise.

      • releaseWriteLockIfHeld

        public boolean releaseWriteLockIfHeld()
        Releases the write lock only and only if the write lock is held by the current thread.
        Returns:
        true if the lock has no more holders, false otherwise.

        public boolean acquireReadLockIfNotHeld()

        Returns:
        true if the lock was acquired within the method, false otherwise.

      • getAcceptedFilesByTheDeployer

        private List<File> getAcceptedFilesByTheDeployer(Collection<File> files,
                                                 Deployer deployer)
        Filters the given list of file to return a collection containing only the file accepted by the deployer.
        Parameters:
        files - the initial set of files
        deployer - the deployer
        Returns:
        the set of accepted file, empty if none are accepted.

      • getDeployersAcceptingFile

        private List<Deployer> getDeployersAcceptingFile(File file)

      • add

        public boolean add(File directory,
                   boolean watch)
        Adds a directory to the watcher. If `watch` is true, the directory is monitored, otherwise only the initial provisioning is done.

        Adds a directory to the watcher. If `watch` is true, the directory is monitored, otherwise only the initial provisioning is done.

        Specified by:
        add in interface Watcher
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory
        watch - true to enable the watch mode.
        Returns:
        true if the directory was added, false otherwise.

      • isDirectoryAlreadyMonitored

        private int isDirectoryAlreadyMonitored(File directory)
        Checks whether a directory is already monitored. It checks if a parent directory is in the monitored list and is really monitored. This avoid creating too much monitor threads.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory
        Returns:
        0 if the directory is already monitored, 1 if a parent directory is monitored, 2 if the directory is there but not monitored, 3 if neither a directory nor its parents are monitored.

      • add

        public boolean add(File directory,
                   long polling)
        Adds a directory to the watcher. If `polling` is not -1, the directory is monitored, otherwise only the initial provisioning is done.

        Adds a directory to the watcher. If `polling` is not -1, the directory is monitored, otherwise only the initial provisioning is done.

        Specified by:
        add in interface Watcher
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory
        polling - the polling period in ms, -1 to disable the watch.
        Returns:
        true if the directory was added, false otherwise.

      • createFileAlterationMonitor

        private org.apache.commons.io.monitor.FileAlterationMonitor createFileAlterationMonitor(File directory,
                                                                                        long polling)

      • openDeployers

        private void openDeployers(File directory)
        Open the deployers on the given directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory

      • removeAndStopIfNeeded

        public boolean removeAndStopIfNeeded(File directory)
        If the directory was added, removes it. If the monitoring was enabled it disables the monitoring. You have to call stop on all directories where the add methods have returned true.

        If the directory is watched, stop it.

        Specified by:
        removeAndStopIfNeeded in interface Watcher
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory
        Returns:
        true if the directory was watched and stopped.
